column6: Response from Hotell Oskar L, Ägare at Hotell OskarResponded Aug 9, 2015
column8: Thanks for all the positive comments and also for the negative ones. Most of them are indeed justified:  We have personally inspected all rooms after the vacation period of our normal staff and we can conclude that indeed not all normal weekly and monthly cleaning (we have a log) has been performed properly by our temporary summer staff, which is unacceptable. We have given feed-back to the staff and we have sharpened up our inspection routines (we normally get super-high scores for cleanliness).  We also discovered some black mould on the silicon seals between the walls and floor in the shower. These seals have been replaced today and we will also inspect all other rooms.   There is nothing wrong with the ventilation in any of the rooms at Hotell Oskar. There is a ventilation system that sucks out air from the bathrooms like it should according to normal Swedish hotel standard. We do not have any air-condition as there are normally only a couple of nights per year where the outside temperature is above 20 degrees and we simply cannot justify such an investment as it would lead to us having to increase room rates.  All the carpets are cleaned with shampoo once a month apart from the daily vacuuming. We ordered new carpets mid June as some of them have small stains from a couple of year's use and as they are light grey it's visible and does not look fresh - despite this they are clean. We have been promised delivery of these carpets (they are custom made for us) by end August.   The size of the bed as well as pictures of it's position in the room is clearly indicated at all the booking sites we are collaborating with so this should be no surprise to our guests.   Finally room 101 is located close to the main entrance door and has windows towards the pedestrian street outside. This means that if you are a light sleeper you are better off in one of our garden-facing rooms.  Kind regards, Klas Wimmerstedt Hotell Oskar

column6: Response from Hotell Oskar L, Ägare at Hotell OskarResponded Sep 16, 2014
column8: Dear Syrnik,  I am so sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay with us and that Hotell Oskar did not live up to your expectations. I think we are very clear about what Hotell Oskar is both at our own website and in all channels where we sell our rooms. Most people like us very much as you have seen from the reviews and I don't think this is anything you can blame either us or TripAdvisor for. The reviews are written completely independently by guests that have stayed with us.  There are, however, a couple of factual points I would like to comment on:  1) Breakfast is always included in the price when you stay at Hotell Oskar 2) The highest price we ever charge for a single room is 133 EUR (1295 SEK) and not 160 EUR 3) The room where you stayed is not large, but it is not 8 sqm like you write - it is 15 sqm 4) The room you stayed in has windows in three directions - towards the pedestrian street, towards our neighbouring house and towards the garden  And finally a subjective comment about the garbage shed in the garden, which you have published a photo of. In my mind it is the most beautiful garbage shed in Lund - and I am proud to say I built it myself - and most guests like our garden very much...  But of course nothing of this will make you change your mind about your stay with us.    Kind regards,  Klas Wimmerstedt

column8: Thanks for your nice review and we are happy that you enjoyed your stay with us!  Regarding the check-in information our process is that we send one confirmation mail at booking and then a second mail with more detailed information about arrival including code two days before arrival. Now in the summer-time we have noticed that we get a lot of last-minute bookings and sometimes (like in your case) the guest does not have access to e-mail immediately before arrival. We have done two things to improve the situation:  1) We have mounted a sign with our 24/7 phone number (where we can always be reached) just beside the entrance door  2) We have activated an automatic SMS function in our booking system so that a text message with the code for the door as well as short arrival instructions is sent on the day before arrival  We hope that these two measures will be enough to eliminate problems. We are, of course, assuming that the guest has a mobile phone if they make a last minute reservation... :-)  We will try this setup and evaluate if we get rid of all problems or if we need to have a fixed check in time with staffed reception from e.g. 16-19 every day.   Cheers, Klas
